title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Italy now recognizes the crime of femicide and punishes it with life in prison
items.description: Italy's parliament on Tuesday approved a law that punishes femicide with life in prison. The vote coincided with the international day for the elimina...

items.title: Huge Fire Engulfs Apartment Buildings in Hong Kong
items.description: Firefighters tried to douse the blaze at an apartment complex in the city’s northern Tai Po district, which killed at least four people.

items.title: How the turkey trotted its way onto our Thanksgiving tables — and into our lexicon

items.title: The Question Hanging Over Peace Talks: What Will Putin Accept?
items.description: A U.S. proposal may cross a number of red lines for the Russian leader, who sees little to lose and much to potentially gain from continuing to fight.

items.title: ‘Imperial Israel’ in the New Middle East
items.description: Despite a cease-fire with Hezbollah, almost daily strikes demonstrate an embolden Israel’s strategy to eliminate its enemies any time, anywhere.

items.title: A Major Moment for the British Economy: What to Watch in the U.K. Budget
items.description: Rachel Reeves, the top economic official in an increasingly unpopular government, will appear in Parliament to present tax and spending plans.

items.description: Plus, some piping hot Thanksgiving takes.

items.title: The U.S. produces a lot of food waste. This place wants to address it
items.description: Even amid rising grocery prices and increased sensitivity to environmental issues, Americans still trash once-edible food at alarming rates.

items.title: The origins of your dog's unique look may be older than you think
items.description: A new study finds that about half of the physical variation seen in modern dogs existed during the Stone Age.

items.title: Fire Engulfs High-Rise Buildings in Hong Kong
items.description: At least four people died after a blaze tore through high-rise apartment towers in Hong Kong on Wednesday, a government spokeswoman said.
